intro: Wikstroemia dolichantha var. effusa, commonly known as the broadleaf wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate to ovate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in spring and are followed by small, woody fruits.
